subject: RE: [JUnit] unit testing - EJB - RemoteException and NoClassDefFo undError
msgSnippet: Good call, Mike.  I didn t pay attention to the name of the class not found! ... From: Mike Clark To: junit@yahoogroups.com Sent: 5/23/01 5:24 PM Subject: Re:
messageBody:
Good call, Mike. I didn't pay attention to the name of the class not found!




-----Original Message-----

From: Mike Clark

To: junit@yahoogroups.com

Sent: 5/23/01 5:24 PM

Subject: Re: [JUnit] unit testing - EJB - RemoteException and
NoClassDefFoundError



[snip]

> [java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Ljavax/ejb/Handle;]"

>

> FAILURES!!!

> Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0

> ----------------------

>



Verify that the JVM running the test has the javax.ejb package in the

CLASSPATH (ejb.jar). The server is probably trying to marshal the

Handle object to the client, and it can't be unmarshalled given the

current CLASSPATH.



Mike
